nfs4_op_lock.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00096 #include <string.h>
00097 #include <pthread.h>
00098 #include <fcntl.h>
00099 #include <sys/file.h>  /* for having FNDELAY */
00100 #include "HashData.h"
00101 #include "HashTable.h"
00102 #ifdef _USE_GSSRPC
00103 #include <gssrpc/types.h>

00145 #define arg_LOCK4 op->nfs_argop4_u.oplock
00146 #define res_LOCK4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.oplock
00147 
00148 int nfs4_op_lock(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00149                      compound_data_t   * data,
00150                      struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00151 {
00152   char                       __attribute__(( __unused__ )) funcname[] = "nfs4_op_lock" ;
00153   cache_inode_status_t       cache_status ;
00154   lock_owner4                lockowner ;
00155   cache_inode_state_data_t   candidate_data ;
00156   cache_inode_state_type_t   candidate_type ;
00157   int                        rc = 0 ; 
00158   cache_inode_state_t      * file_state = NULL ;
00159   cache_inode_state_t      * pstate_found = NULL ;
00160   cache_inode_state_t      * pstate_previous_iterate = NULL ;
00161   cache_inode_state_t      * pstate_found_iterate = NULL ;
00162   uint64_t                   distance = 0LL ;
00163   nfs_client_id_t            nfs_client_id ;
00164 
00165   /* Lock are not supported */
00166   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_LOCK ;
00167   res_LOCK4.status =  NFS4ERR_LOCK_NOTSUPP ;
00168 
00169   /* If there is no FH */
00170   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->currentFH  ) ) )
00171     {
00172       res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00173       return res_LOCK4.status ;
00174     }
00175 
00176   /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00177   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->currentFH ) ) )
00178     {
00179       res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00180       return res_LOCK4.status ;
00181     }
00182 
00183   /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00184   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00185     {
00186       res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00187       return res_LOCK4.status ;
00188     }
00189 
00190   /* Commit is done only on a file */
00191   if( data->current_filetype != REGULAR_FILE )
00192     {
00193         /* Type of the entry is not correct */
00194         switch( data->current_filetype )
00195           {
00196              case DIR_BEGINNING:
00197              case DIR_CONTINUE:
00198                 res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_ISDIR ;
00199                 break ;
00200              default:
00201                 res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00202                 break ;
00203           }
00204     }
00205 
00206   /* Lock length should not be 0 */
00207   if( arg_LOCK4.length == 0LL )
00208     {
00209        res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00210        return res_LOCK4.status ;
00211     }
00212 
00213   /* Check for range overflow 
00214    * Remember that a length with all bits set to 1 means "lock until the end of file" (RFC3530, page 157) */
00215   if( arg_LOCK4.length != 0xffffffffffffffffLL ) 
00216     {
00217         /* Comparing beyond 2^64 is not possible int 64 bits precision, but off+len > 2^64 is equivalent to len > 2^64 - off */
00218         if( arg_LOCK4.length > ( 0xffffffffffffffffLL - arg_LOCK4.offset ) )
00219           {
00220              res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00221              return res_LOCK4.status ;
00222           }
00223     }
00224 
00225   /* loop into the states related to this pentry to find the related lock */
00226   pstate_found_iterate = NULL ;
00227   pstate_previous_iterate = pstate_found ;
00228   do
00229    {
00230      cache_inode_state_iterate( data->current_entry,
00231                                 &pstate_found_iterate,
00232                                 pstate_previous_iterate, 
00233                                 data->pclient,
00234                                 data->pcontext, 
00235                                 &cache_status ) ;
00236       if( ( cache_status == CACHE_INODE_STATE_ERROR ) || ( cache_status == CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ) )
00237        {
00238           res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00239           return res_LOCK4.status ;
00240        }
00241 
00242       if( pstate_found_iterate != NULL ) 
00243        {
00244         if( pstate_found_iterate->state_type == CACHE_INODE_STATE_LOCK )
00245          {
00246             /* We found a lock, check is they overlap */
00247             if( arg_LOCK4.offset > pstate_found_iterate->state_data.lock.offset )
00248                distance = arg_LOCK4.offset -  pstate_found_iterate->state_data.lock.offset ;
00249             else
00250                distance = pstate_found_iterate->state_data.lock.offset -  arg_LOCK4.offset ;
00251 
00252             if( distance <= ( arg_LOCK4.length + pstate_found_iterate->state_data.lock.length ) )
00253              {
00254                /* Locks are overlapping */
00255                
00256 
00257                /* If both lock are READ, this is not a case of error  */
00258                if(  ( arg_LOCK4.locktype != READ_LT ) || (  pstate_found_iterate->state_data.lock.lock_type != READ_LT ) )
00259                  {
00260                    /* Overlapping lock is found, if owner is different than the calling owner, return NFS4ERR_DENIED */
00261                    if( ( lockowner.owner.owner_len == pstate_found_iterate->state_owner.owner.owner_len ) &&
00262                        ( !memcmp( lockowner.owner.owner_val,
00263                                   pstate_found_iterate->state_owner.owner.owner_val, 
00264                                   pstate_found_iterate->state_owner.owner.owner_len ) ) )
00265                     {
00266                        /* The calling state owner is the same. There is a discussion on this case at page 161 of RFC3530. I choose to ignore this
00267                         * lock and continue iterating on the other states */        
00268                     }
00269                    else
00270                     {
00271                        /* A  conflicting lock from a different lock_owner, returns NFS4ERR_DENIED */
00272                        res_LOCK4.LOCK4res_u.denied.offset   = pstate_found_iterate->state_data.lock.offset ;
00273                        res_LOCK4.LOCK4res_u.denied.length   = pstate_found_iterate->state_data.lock.length ;
00274                        res_LOCK4.LOCK4res_u.denied.locktype = pstate_found_iterate->state_data.lock.lock_type ;
00275                        res_LOCK4.LOCK4res_u.denied.owner.owner.owner_len = pstate_found_iterate->state_owner.owner.owner_len ;
00276                        res_LOCK4.LOCK4res_u.denied.owner.owner.owner_val = pstate_found_iterate->state_owner.owner.owner_val ;
00277                        res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_DENIED ;
00278                        return res_LOCK4.status ;
00279                     } 
00280                 }
00281              }
00282          }
00283        }
00284      pstate_previous_iterate = pstate_found_iterate ;
00285    } while( pstate_found_iterate != NULL ) ;
00286 
00287   
00288   /* Is this a new lock owner or not ? */
00289   if( arg_LOCK4.locker.new_lock_owner == TRUE )
00290    {
00291       /* this is a new lockowner */
00292       lockowner = arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.open_owner.lock_owner ;
00293 
00294       /* A lock owner is always associated with a previously made open
00295        * which has itself a previously made stateid */
00296 
00297       /* Check stateid correctness */
00298       if( ( rc = nfs4_Check_Stateid( &arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.open_owner.open_stateid, data->current_entry ) )  != NFS4_OK )
00299        {
00300          res_LOCK4.status = rc ;
00301          return res_LOCK4.status ;
00302        }
00303 
00304       /* Check is the clientid is known or not */
00305       if( nfs_client_id_get( arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.open_owner.lock_owner.clientid, 
00306                              &nfs_client_id ) == CLIENT_ID_NOT_FOUND )
00307        {
00308          res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_STALE_CLIENTID ;
00309          return res_LOCK4.status ;
00310        }
00311 
00312       /* Try to get the related stateid */
00313       if( cache_inode_get_state( arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.open_owner.open_stateid.other,
00314                                  &pstate_found,
00315                                  data->pclient,
00316                                  &cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00317        {
00318           res_LOCK4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00319           return res_LOCK4.status ;
00320        }
00321 
00322      /* An open state has been found. Check its type */
00323      if( pstate_found->state_type != CACHE_INODE_STATE_SHARE )
00324       {
00325          res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_STATEID ;
00326          return res_LOCK4.status ;
00327       }
00328 
00329 #ifdef _DEBUG_LOCK
00330      printf( "=== New Owner ===> %u %u %u\n", arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.open_owner.open_stateid.seqid,
00331                                               arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.open_owner.open_seqid, pstate_found->seqid ) ;
00332 #endif
00333 
00334      /* check the stateid */
00335      if( arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.open_owner.open_stateid.seqid < pstate_found->seqid )
00336        {
00337           res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_OLD_STATEID ;
00338           return res_LOCK4.status ;
00339        } 
00340 
00341      /* Check validity of the seqid */
00342      if( ( arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.open_owner.open_seqid < pstate_found->seqid ) ||
00343          ( arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.open_owner.open_seqid > pstate_found->seqid +2 ) )
00344        {
00345           res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_SEQID ;
00346           return res_LOCK4.status ;
00347        } 
00348 
00349      /* Sanity check : Is this the right file ? */
00350      if( pstate_found->pentry != data->current_entry )
00351       {
00352          res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_STATEID ;
00353          return res_LOCK4.status ;
00354       }
00355 
00356      /* Lock seqid (seqid wanted for new lock) should be 0 (see newpynfs test LOCK8c)  */
00357      if(  arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.open_owner.lock_seqid != 0 )
00358        {
00359           res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_SEQID ;
00360           return res_LOCK4.status ;
00361        }
00362 
00363      /* No conflict found. Prepare state management structure */
00364      candidate_type = CACHE_INODE_STATE_LOCK ;
00365      candidate_data.lock.lock_type = arg_LOCK4.locktype ;
00366      candidate_data.lock.offset    = arg_LOCK4.offset ;
00367      candidate_data.lock.length    = arg_LOCK4.length ;
00368    }
00369   else
00370    {
00371       /* The owner already exists, use the provided owner to create a new state */
00372       /* Get the former state */
00373       if( cache_inode_get_state( arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.lock_owner.lock_stateid.other, 
00374                                  &pstate_found, 
00375                                  data->pclient,
00376                                  &cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00377        {
00378           res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_STALE_STATEID ;
00379           return res_LOCK4.status ;
00380        }
00381 
00382       /* An lock state has been found. Check its type */
00383       if( pstate_found->state_type != CACHE_INODE_STATE_LOCK )
00384        {
00385           res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_STATEID ;
00386           return res_LOCK4.status ;
00387        }
00388 
00389 #ifdef _DEBUG_LOCK
00390      printf( "=== Konwn LockOwner ===> %u %u %u\n", arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.lock_owner.lock_stateid.seqid,
00391                                    arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.lock_owner.lock_seqid, pstate_found->seqid ) ;
00392 #endif
00393 
00394      /* Check if stateid is not too old */
00395      if( arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.lock_owner.lock_stateid.seqid < pstate_found->seqid )
00396        {
00397           res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_OLD_STATEID ;
00398           return res_LOCK4.status ;
00399        }
00400 
00401      /* Check good seq id */
00402      if( arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.lock_owner.lock_seqid > arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.lock_owner.lock_stateid.seqid )
00403        {
00404           res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_SEQID ;
00405           return res_LOCK4.status ;
00406        }
00407 
00408      /* Check validity of the desired seqid */
00409      if( (  arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.lock_owner.lock_seqid !=  pstate_found->seqid ) &&
00410          (  arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.lock_owner.lock_seqid != pstate_found->seqid + 1 ) )
00411        {
00412           res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_SEQID ;
00413           return res_LOCK4.status ;
00414        }
00415 
00416 #ifdef _CONFORM_TO_TEST_LOCK8c
00417      /* Check validity of the seqid */
00418      if(  arg_LOCK4.locker.locker4_u.lock_owner.lock_seqid != 0 )
00419        {
00420           res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_SEQID ;
00421           return res_LOCK4.status ;
00422        }
00423 #endif
00424 
00425      /* Sanity check : Is this the right file ? */
00426      if( pstate_found->pentry != data->current_entry )
00427       {
00428          res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_STATEID ;
00429          return res_LOCK4.status ;
00430       }
00431 
00432      memcpy( (char *)&lockowner, (char *)&(pstate_found->state_owner), sizeof( lock_owner4 ) ) ; 
00433    } 
00434  
00435 
00436    if( arg_LOCK4.locker.new_lock_owner == TRUE )
00437     { 
00438       /* Add the lock state to the lock table */
00439       if( cache_inode_add_state( data->current_entry,
00440                                  candidate_type,
00441                                  &candidate_data, 
00442                                  1, /* Lock have a initial seqid of 1 */
00443                                  ((open_owner4 *)&lockowner),
00444                                  data->pclient,
00445                                  data->pcontext,
00446                                  &file_state,
00447                                  &cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00448         {
00449           res_LOCK4.status = NFS4ERR_STALE_STATEID ;
00450           return res_LOCK4.status ;
00451         }
00452 
00454       res_LOCK4.LOCK4res_u.resok4.lock_stateid.seqid = file_state->seqid ;
00455       memcpy( res_LOCK4.LOCK4res_u.resok4.lock_stateid.other, file_state->stateid_other, 12 ) ;
00456     }
00457   else
00458     {
00459       /* Increment the seqid */
00460       pstate_found->seqid += 1 ;
00461       res_LOCK4.LOCK4res_u.resok4.lock_stateid.seqid = pstate_found->seqid ;
00462       memcpy( res_LOCK4.LOCK4res_u.resok4.lock_stateid.other, pstate_found->stateid_other, 12 ) ;
00463     }
00464 #ifdef _DEBUG_STATES
00465   nfs_State_PrintAll(  ) ;
00466 #endif
00467 
00468   res_LOCK4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00469   return res_LOCK4.status;
00470 } /* nfs4_op_lock */
00471 
00472     
00483 void nfs4_op_lock_Free( LOCK4res * resp )
00484 { 
00485   /* Nothing to Mem_Free */
00486   return ;
00487 } /* nfs4_op_lock_Free */
Generated on Tue Mar 31 14:37:44 2009 for NFS and Mount protocols layer by  1.5.7.1
